column1: short of length delivery on off, defended with soft hands
hops back and defends this short of length ball. This one just held on a touch
helped along to the fine leg boundary. Too short, line way outside leg. Easy pickings.

just over the outstretched hands of Taylor at a wide first slip! Wafts at this delivery, nothing shot really. Thick outside edge, once it beat the cordon, it raced away to the third man boundary. Taylor had no time and stuck his left-hand out. Good try.
almighty heave and he's picked the bones out of it. Stand and deliver. Length ball slanting away and he disdainfully slaps this across the line
play and a miss. Much fuller this time, hint of nip away. Beaten
full and angled across, no swing back in this time, left alone.
angles this down to third man to get off the mark
slips this down leg, he hops back and tickles this down to fine leg
full and straight on the stumps, hint of swing in, Noor Ali looks to flick it square but squirts this wide of point off a thick outside edge. Would've been plumb had he not hit it
squared up by the length but manages to defend it from the crease
shows the full face of the bat as he eases this to mid-off
hint of width outside off, steered to point
biffed across the line, nearly picked out deep midwicket.
beaten for pace, late to react as he's hit high on the right thigh trying to defend this short of length delivery.
gets a thick inside edge onto the pad as he plays outside the line of this delivery

shapes away from a length outside off, eased to backward point where Santner throws himself to his left to stop the ball, saved a couple of runs. Zazai was slow out of the blocks, could've been interesting if there was a clean pick-up and throw
floated full on off, defended with soft hands
squared up again by this short of length delivery, but he manages to defend it by getting behind the line
floated full and wide, beaten as he looks to squeeze this behind point
eased down to square third man, sensibly done by Noor Ali
was looking to pull but decided to change his stroke and just defend from the crease in the end. Good call that
huge appeal for lbw, but this would've missed leg stump. Hit on the pad as he looked to flick this wide of square leg. Also got an inside-edge.
looked to wallop this full delivery across the line, missed. Had a big swing
shot of the morning! Too full and it got what it deserved. Noor Ali hits this bullet drive back past the bowler. Raced past him even before Henry could react on his followthrough
gentle dab into the off side with soft hands for a quick single
heaved across the line, goes miles in the air, midwicket and deep square run across but neither can get to the ball. Had to fetch it from a long way outside off.
blind swing again, looking to wallop this from way outside off to the cow-corner region. Beaten

high in the air, very, very high. Colin de Grandhomme and Guptill were looking at each other, neither went full throttle and the catch goes down. The wind was taking the ball away from them, three players converging, in the end De Grandhomme went one handed as an afterthought and fluffed it
right behind the line as he defends this full delivery
swivels back and pulls this all along the ground to long leg
slants this one across the batsman, left alone
thumped on the up, beats mid-off. Sublime timing. A shot that will give you immense confidence as a batsman
squared up by the late movement, cracker of a delivery. Feet glued to the crease as he wafted at this
gets a thick outside edge to square third man
eases this length ball to point
punches this short of length delivery to extra cover
delightful timing and terrific wrist work! Slanting into the pads, Noor Ali is balanced well as he whips this into the gap at midwicket
defends with soft hands into the off side,looks for a single but is sent back
punched, thought he hit it into the gap but Neesham comes up with a terrific one-handed stop at cover point
hops back and defends back. This was bowled at 144kph
squeezes this fuller delivery to point, hesitation with the running. They eventually decide against the single
slash and a miss. This was just flirting with the wide line

dropped at first slip by Taylor! Absolutely flew to his right, stuck his right hand out. Zazai was squared up, this one came off the edge. It lobbed in the air, briefly raising hopes of a parry but went down. Tough, tough chance
chases this full and wide delivery, looking to square drive but misses
excellent bouncer. Sways out of the way
another skiddy bouncer at 138kph, second for the over, Noor Ali ducks under this without a hassle
neatly steered down to square third man
squirted down to third man, took the bottom hand off as he jabbed at this
what a shot! This has been absolutely plundered deep into the stands at deep square leg. Picked the length so early and walloped this pull nonchalantly. 89-metre hit, new balls please
went for a big swing down the ground, beaten by the slower ball. Zazai has decided he'll either go hell or high water this afternoon
slapped! This races to the cover boundary like a tracer bullet as Ravi Shastri'd famously say. Too short, enough width and he gave it a proper whack
big swing and a miss, Henry went full and a touch wide, looked to whack across the line. Not needed, but well, that's the way he plays.
pulled all along the ground, Guptill patrolling the short midwicket boundary comes up with a dive to stop that
tickled fine, no one at 45. Four easy runs! Poor first ball down leg.
another one down leg, looks to tickle fine again, deflects off the thigh pad to square leg
lifter that he almost nicks off! Got big on him, he was on the hop trying to fend, but is lucky to get away
short ball outside off at 144kph, Noor Ali drops his wrists and gets out of the way
delightful square drive! Too full, balance and timing absolutely magnificent. Got to the pitch, used the width and laced it all along the ground. All class
gets on top of the bounce and works this behind square on the leg side.
good length ball, squares up the batsman and beats him on the outside edge.
overpitched on off, minimum of movement but maximum efficiency in this glorious straight drive through mid-off.
short of a length on off, goes back to defend.
fullish length on middle, clipped through to deep midwicket.

finally gets him after surviving two lives on 16 & 18! Zazai loves clearing the front leg to go over the on-side and Neesham wisely teases him dragging this line wider outside off stump, the front leg still flies out and the arms try to flay this over cover. The ball flies in the air toward the point sweeper Munro, who charges in 12 yards and takes this at chest height while crouching down. Zazai taps his helmet with the bat. Soaring like an eagle at the start, his wings have been clipped by Neesham.
back of a length ball, Rahmat doesn't get the feet moving as this seams away a touch to beat the prod.

gobbled up down the leg side! Ferguson banged it in on the hips, Noor Ali tried to do a penguin shuffle across to feather this behind square but only manages a slight tickle and Latham with the grace of a pelican takes it with ease at neck height. Kiwis on top now.
good length ball on off, clipped to midwicket.
bouncer, clears Shahidi who ducks under.
another bouncer, this time well outside off, Shahidi cranes his neck back while swaying away.
good length ball on leg stump angled across to off, defended confidently on the back foot back down the pitch.
what a gem! Ferguson seams this across the outside edge at 147 kph/91 mph, Shahidi flat-footed with the prod as this pitches outside leg and cuts across off stump beating the edge.
good length ball pitching on fourth stump angled into off, defended on the back foot to extra cover.
short of a length on fifth stump line, no movement, left alone with ease.

leading edge flies to Guptill at backward point! Not the best ball, pitching on middle and angling onto leg stump on a fullish length, Rahmat wanted to flick this through square leg but he's out in front of it as it holds up a touch. The ball flies toward Guptill, who leans over to his left taking the catch falling over with a mini swan dive. Four-ball duck for Rahmat.
fullish length, defended to point.
short of a length on the stumps, hops up to tap it down to square leg.
fullish length on fifth stump, in the slot for Gulbadin to thrash this like a barracuda over Neesham.

good length pitching outside leg and cutting across onto middle, Shahidi squared up again and squirts and edge to point. Ferguson troubling him consistently with this angle wide of the crease coming over the stumps.
bouncer on leg stump angled outside off, Shahidi flinches while ducking under.
full pitching on off stump and continues on with the angle, shoulders arms to leave on the front foot.
pitches on a good length on leg and continues to angle across, beats the flat-foot prod.
fullish length on middle, defended to backward point.
short of a length pitching outside leg angled into off stump, met by Shahidi on the back foot with a confident defensive block.

short outside off, Gulbadin goes to cut and given out! He reviews straight away. Would've been called a wide had he left it alone. Really had to reach out for it. But Ultraedge shows a spike as it passes the bat. Poor review from the captain. After flying high in the Powerplay, Afghanistan now doing a falcon-dive hurtling back to earth.
good length ball on the legs, defended into the ground dribbling to short midwicket.
full on the legs, clipped off the pads to long leg.
short of a length on middle, defended to point.
good length ball on middle, defended on the front foot back to Neesham.
fullish length angled across on fifth stump line, sucks Shahidi into a drive and he's beaten.
fullish length on the legs, clipped off the pads into the ground to leg slip.
good length outside off on sixth stump, left alone at 86 mph.
fullish length again on sixth stump at 89 mph, Nabi shoulders arms after a stride onto the front foot.
short of a length again on sixth stump, Ferguson not getting tight enough to the stumps to tempt Nabi into spreading his wings.
very full on fifth stump, Nabi finally reaches out to have a sniff at this with the bat and is beaten.
short on fifth stump, Nabi sways back as this climbs on him at 86 mph.
full on off, blocked into the off side to point.
fullish length on off, de Grandhomme bowling much tighter to the stumps making Shahidi play and defends to cover.
fullish length on fifth stump, Shahidi wants to drive to mid-off but miscues it to midwicket.
full on off at 72 mph, defended to cover.
full on off at 75 mph, defended again to the off side.
full on fifth stump, mock cheers for Shahidi as he finally gets off the mark on his 20th ball pushing a single wide of mid-off.
fullish length on fourth stump, Shahidi tries to work this to the leg side, leading edge lands short of point.
short outside off, flat-footed cut attempted, beaten.
full on off, defended firmly on the front foot at 85 mph/137 kph.
fullish length pitching on off and angled across fourth stump line, Shahidi goes back to cut, cramped for room and is beaten.
full on off stump, prodded back to Neesham.
good length on off stump, goes back to defend to backward point.
full on fourth stump, Nabi strides confidently onto the front foot to defend back to de Grandhomme.
fullish length on fifth stump, steps forward to push this through the covers.
Shahidi getting twitchy, shuffles down the pitch to attack a length ball outside off, beaten comfortably.
Shahidi breaks the shackles. Good length ball but plenty of width, coming around the width, frees the arms to flay this past point.
good length ball angled in on fifth stump, guided with an open face to Ferguson at third man on the rope, slips and falls on his backside bending down to field on a damp outfield.
short of a length on fourth stump, Nabi opens the face to run this to third man.
attempted yorker, dug out to the leg side.
full and very wide outside off, left alone. Lucky to not be called a wide.
full and very wide again, left comfortably as it just hugs the wide guideline outside off.
good length ball on the legs, clipped behind square for an easy single.
full on the stumps, punched back to Neesham off a bounce, knocked away with his left hand to cover.
short of a length down the legs, Nabi steps inside the line to pull and misses. Wide called well down the leg side.
full on off, Nabi gets out the 6-iron to chip this high over Neesham. It plops down 10 yards short of the rope and doesn't bounce any further.
cracking stroke to resume play! Loose delivery, half-volley outside off and he played a picture-perfect cover drive. So good to watch
width and he cuts this late towards square third man
nice and full outside off, squirts this off a thick inside edge to midwicket
nice and full outside off, he gets well forward and defends
goes back and across as he turns this back down the pitch
driven on the up to deep point
floats it full outside off, Nabi gets well forward and defends
sways out of the way of this short ball, but it's bowled way over the batsman's head.
width outside off and he cuts it down to third man, where de Grandhomme slides to his right to cut that off
looks to help this along but the ball skids through to beat his whip, deflects off the thigh pad to square leg
slants one across the left-hander, watched through to the keeper
hint of a tickle down leg, Latham can't stop it despite a full-length dive to his right. Wong line, full on leg. Easy pickings. Welcome boundary
pristine drive on the up to deep point
ducks under this skiddy short ball on middle
hops back into the crease and bunts this into the off side
right behind the line as he defends
steers this down to third man as New Zealand raise their 100
excellent short ball, he hops back and plays it with soft hands into the off side
hops back and bunts it gently into the off side
slips this down leg and Hashmatullah says 'thank you.' Worked away nicely to beat fine leg.
cut away! Width and he got on top of the bounce nicely to ease that to deep point

what a poor stroke from an experienced campaigner. Nothing shot, hangs his bat out, presumably to late cut, but this one bounces a touch more than Nabi expects, gets a thin edge and Latham does the rest. Latham now has four.
nice and full on the stumps, he gets well forward and blocks

punched into the gap between cover and point. Rain or no rain, when your timing is pristine like that, you will get full value for your shots. Terrific placement, got into great position. Right on top of the bounce

maiden five-for for Neesh! Is he allowed to tweet a reaction to that? Oh, well. This is a corker of a delivery. Slants one on a length. climbs on Najibullah who is squared up by the late deviation and then thin edge, right off the shoulder of the bat, is gleefully accepted by Latham.
half-volley on the pads and he flicks this behind square. Lovely timing, roll of the wrists perfect.
beaten by a skiddy length ball that goes straight on. He was playing for the late inward movement
angling into the pads, tucked to deep midwicket
right behind the line of this length ball as he defends with soft hands
goes for the kill with full and straight delivery on the stumps from wide of the crease, squeezed back. Misfield at mid-on and Ikram almost had his first World Cup runs. Almost.
sways out of the way of this short ball quite nicely
pushes at this full delivery from the crease into the off side
hops back to keep out this length ball on the stumps
nips away off the deck from outside off, left alone
punches this to mid-off
looks to arch back and help it over the cordon to third man, beaten. Smashes the air in anger as he missed that
steered down to third man for an easy single

welcome back, Matt. Flayed on the up through extra cover. Nothing wrong with the delivery, really. Did he expect the batsman to play him out? Hashmatullah was waiting to put that away. He needed just a hint of width
typical reaction from a fast bowler to a boundary. Dug in sort, Hashmatullah ducks under this
gets an thin inside edge that smashes into the box as he wafts outside the line. Flattened for a second but he's back on his feet
mistimes this cut to cover point
width outside off, steered to deep point
gets right on top of the bounce as he plays it into the off side
bunted down to third man
goes back and across as he defends

crunching cover drive but this is an outstanding stop by Santner at cover. Threw himself to his right to stop that. He was airborne when he caught that on the bounce. Excellent recovery too, in a jiffy even though there was no threat of a run
gets out of the way of this short ball by dropping his wrists nicely
left alone again even though there was a temptation to have a slash at that
rooted to the crease, opened up with his right shoulder facing the bowler as he defends
thick inside edge, flies past leg stump to the fine leg boundary. Hands on head for Matt Henry. How unlucky
nice and full on off, defended from the crease
dug in short at decent pace, Hashmatullah ducks under this
crashed to deep point, too much width. Lucky to get away with that
squeezes the drive to point
right on top of the bounce as he defends gently towards gully
floated full and across the batsman, left alone
lifter on a length outside off, left alone
defended as he gets besides the line
full and slanting across again, invitation there for the drive on the up but he's happy to let it go
hops back into the crease and defends
works this into the gap at midwicket as they scamper a single. Neesham finishes with 5 for 31,  a day's pay well-earned, although he wouldn't mind coming in later to have a whack.
full on fourth stump, driven to cover.
short outside off, cut toward Guptill at point, who paws it out of the air with his left hand.
full on the legs, chipped to deep midwicket on a few bounces.
bouncer, sails over the batsman, could've been called a wide on height but the umpire lets it pass.
full on fifth stump, defended to cover.

dropped! Almost a carbon copy of the first dropped chance by Taylor at slip to Zazai early in the innings. Henry went short on off stump to Alikhil, who fended at it with an angled bat leaping off his toes. It clipped the edge and flew high to Taylor at slip, he hopped in the air and reached high over his head with his right hand but could only manage to parry it away to third man. He got plenty of palm behind it, more than just the fingertips, but it didn't stick.
fullish length on middle at 84 mph, defended into the off side.
short of a length pitching on leg and angled across off, Alikhil fends awkwardly at it off the back foot, beaten for pace.
fullish length pitching on leg and angled into off stump, defended on the back foot back down the pitch.

good length pitching on leg angled to off, Alikhil angles the bat away from his body to block this toward cover, inside edge goes to short midwicket and they scamper a nervy run. Shahidi dives to make his ground but beats the underhand flick by a few yards.
short of a length on middle, defended after hopping onto the back foot into midwicket.
fullish length on fifth stump angled in, Shahidi plays away from his body, beaten between bat and pad but not close to hitting off stump.
fullish length on fifth stump, defended to backward point.
good length ball on fourth stump angled in, defended on the back foot back to de Grandhomme fielding in his follow-through charging right.
good length ball angled in from wide of the stumps on a sixth stump line, Alikhil tries to punch this off the back foot behind point but can't pierce the field.

sucker ball claims Alikhil at backward point! Attempted wide yorker outside off just pitches before Alikhil drives hard, but Alikhil's back knee dips instead of getting on top of the ball to be able to drive this into the ground. Instead he slices under it and it flutters like a peaceful dove toward Guptill at backward point, taken on his haunches at chest height with fingers pointed to the sky.
short on the stumps, defended to point.
full on off, driven to cover.
bouncer, easily ducked under.
full and wide, driven hard and goes off a bounce and off the leg of gully.
short outside off, beaten for pace and cramped for room trying to cut.

brutal! Ferguson with a skiddy ball short of a length that has a touch of extra bounce at 138 kph/86 mph. Rashid came a step forward to defend but it climbs into his helmet and ricochets down onto the stumps. Kane Williamson, his captain at Sunrisers, comes over to put his arm around Rashid and check on him as the champion leggie is shaken up. Physio is out on field to escort him off as his eyes start bulging.
squawk! What a shot to play first ball. Very full targeting middle stump, Aftab steps away to leg and slaps this wide of mid-off, screeching away to the rope.
good length on middle angling into Aftab backing away from the stumps again to slog, he goes to heave over mid-on but a bottom edge knuckles down the pitch back to Ferguson.
Shahidi gets inside the line of a short ball to pull off the gloves behind square.
bouncer, clears Aftab swaying back.
full and wide, attempted yorker is driven out to deep point.
yorker on off, dug out with a touch of drama and the ball trickles wide enough of Latham to allow a run.
bouncer pitching outside leg as Aftab backs away clumsily to leg with an awkward hook. Misses badly.
slower ball on a good length on middle stump, Aftab keeps his hands back while backing away to guide this behind point to third man. Boult has a chuckle with him at the end of the over.
nearly another wicket! Ferguson follows him backing away from the stumps with a short ball and Aftab heaves a pull just wide of mid-on, de Grandhomme jogging right and diving in vain on the ring.

top edge sails almost for six! Ferguson angled this away from the stumps on a fullish length trying to create that skied chance from around the stumps. It happens as Aftab backs away from leg to slog once more but it sails straight over the keeper, one bounce over the rope.
cat and mouse backing away game here continues. Aftab backs away, Ferguson pitches this outside leg, swing and a miss.

Aftab's adventurous stay ends. Identical shot to two balls earlier backing away to a short ball. That angle was going to keep producing top edges and sure enough this one is skied over the wicketkeeper towards third man. Latham tracks back to the edge of the ring calling off third man running in from the rope and takes a very sharp catch over the shoulder, 7.5/10 on degree of difficulty particularly with the ball tailing away. He's got five takes in the innings, one away from tying the ODI record.
attempted yorker, lands too full and driven firmly wide of mid-on. Not bad for a No. 11!
short on the stumps, pulls through square leg but not timed well. Neesham tracks it down from the ring.
short of a length on middle, defended after a bunny hop to extra cover.
short on the stumps, Shahidi hurried trying to pull, top edge sails over Latham, two bounces and four.
full on off, driven to mid-off.
slower ball on a good length wide outside off, Shahidi swings past it at 76 mph.
knee high full toss follows Shahidi backing away. Mistimes a swat back to mid-on.
full on middle, driven firmly to mid-on and Shahidi hustles to pinch a single and keep strike for the next over to protect Hamid.
attempted yorker, Shahidi backs away and slams a full ball through wide mid-on, races away and 50 up for Shahidi!
short on the stumps, backs away for a slog with his head bobbing around and misses badly.
yorker pitches outside leg stump with Shahidi backing away missing a swipe.
yorker on fourth stump, Shahidi waves at it and an edge goes off the toe to third man on the rope. Hamid with two balls to see off.
bouncer on the body, Hamid backs away and flails, misses.
short ball on the body, Hamid struggles to fend this off awkwardly with his hands.
short ball on the stumps, Shahidi dramatically falls back onto the ground, not close to trodding on his stumps though.
short outside off, Shahidi tries to uppercut this over the wk and misses.
short of a length on fourth stump angled in, Shahidi tries for the uppercut again but seriously cramped for room, beaten for pace. Close to gloving that to Latham.
attempted yorker misfired at knee height on leg stump, gimme ball for Shahidi and he flicks this through midwicket.
Boult goes back to the bouncer, this time ducked under with a bit less fuss from Shahidi.

very poor ball for the plan from Boult. Short on the body, Shahidi gets inside the line to tuck a short arm jab behind square, he's hit on the gloves and it dribbles to the edge of the ring at fine leg. He's calling for the physio after that ball though as he was pinged on the left hand and is shaking it vigorously.
overpitched on off stump, driven to extra cover. Shahidi rips off his glove again after that delivery to look at his pinky again.
short on the stumps, Shahidi backs away to uppercut it over Latham and misses.
short of a length pitching well outside leg stump, they scamper the first clipped toward long leg but Shahidi can't get back for the second to keep strike. Hamid to see off three balls now.
backs away from leg stump slightly to heave over midwicket to a length ball angled across off stump, can't connect. Sure top edge for third man if he does.
short of a length on the body, this time Hamid stands his ground and fights it off his hips behind square.
full and wide, Shahidi shuffles well across his stumps for this slower ball at 77 mph, guided with soft hands behind point for a run to keep strike.
backs away and slaps this short ball to deep point, Hashmatullah takes the run reluctantly
nice and full on the stumps, kept out
sways out of this short ball angling across
goes full and straight, searching for that yorker, kept out
yorker-length outside off, squeezed to backward point
lifter outside off, excellent leave

what a catch! This was a leading edge that for the most part seemed as if it'd fall short of third man. But the anticipation is top notch from Henry. Comes haring in, gets the angle right as he runs in a few steps and then dives forward and completed the catch.

dream start! This is a skiddy short of length ball that comes back in sharply to surprise Guptill who hops back to defend, but only manages an inside edge onto the thigh pad as it lobs to point. Aftab Alam, you beauty.
tucked away to deep square leg, a lazy effort in the deep, a clumsy effort resulting in a misfield, gives them a second.
gentle length ball on middle and leg, whipped wide of midwicket
belted down the ground, mid-off was a mere spectator. No sighters needed. Saw this in his half and just came through nicely
square drive right out of the top drawer. Length, he leant into the stroke and just let his hand-eye coordination do the rest. Superb
squared up by the length from around the stumps, squirted to point
hops back and tucks this off his hip to square leg
defended firmly to mid-off
steps out to flat-bat this over extra cover, but played too early. Beaten. Wide for height.
width outside off, looks to flay this on the up but is beaten
beauty! Beaten by the big deviation off the deck. This was a length ball that zipped away. Munro played inside the line. This was bowled at 141kph
slashed down to square third man, excellent stop by Aftab
excellent leave to this short of length delivery outside off, came back in a long way.
slips this down leg, excellent take by Ikram diving full length to his right. Munro was looking to tickle it fine
punched to backward point
just a gentle push as he gets half-forward, lets the timing do the rest, no chance for mid-off despite the dive
slower and fuller on the pads, looks to flick it over midwicket, ball deflects off the pad to square leg
gets on top of the bounce and defends with a loose bottom grip, down to gully
defends with his bat close to the body again
tucks this gently to midwicket
curls away a hint, the length is quite full, pushed to mid-off
goes right back and across as he bunts this into the off side

leading edge but this lobs over point, down to square third man. How unlucky. Excellent bowling, Munro looking to work it square, this deviated late again. He's hitting the deck hard at a lively clip. Top work by Aftab running around to his left from third man
taps this gently towards the man coming in from square leg for a quick single
shot! Lazy elegance, something about that was utterly beautiful. Length ball angling away, he just plonked forward, opened the bat face and sliced this between cover and point.
punched straight to cover
slips this length ball on middle and leg, works this to long leg
angles this back in a long way from around the stumps, hit on the pad as he looks to work it square
cramped for room, mistimes this attempted short-arm jab to mid-on
wristy whip down to deep midwicket
works this full delivery on middle and leg to mid-on
beaten, this one sneaks past the inside edge to hit the pad and roll to the off side. No lbw appeal as this was slipping down.
gentle push into the covers as they sprint through for a single
cuts back in to hit him high on the pad and roll to the off side. Williamson surprised by the pace and bounce

off a thick inside edge, races to the fine leg boundary. Stood tall to punch but is once again surprised by how quickly this got to him. He's hitting the hard lengths quite effortlessly here. Hint of uncertainty from KW, but he's lucky to get away this time.
slips this down leg, wide called. Scoring opportunity missed
defends with his bat close to the pad
squeezes out this full delivery back down the pitch
short of length delivery outside off, left alone
defends this length ball back to the bowler
slashed over the slips, one bounce to third man. Nearly spun past him. Somehow managed to get his big palms behind the line.
mistimes this cut to cover
gets half-forward and defends back to the bowler
full just outside off, bunted with an angled bat face to the off side

punched into the gap between cover and point. Sublime timing. Picked the length so early, transferred his weight back and let his balance and timing do the rest. Didn't try to over-hit the ball, just sped away
stands tall and defends into the off side
looks to punch on the up, gets a thick inside edge to midwicket
tucks this gently to square leg
gets on top of the bounce and works this wide of midwicket
looks to upper cut, doesn't quit get the timing right and he hits it straight down the throat of third man. If there was a wicket well deserved, it was this. Superb from Aftab.
nice and full on off stump, gets half-forward and defends
works this length delivery on middle to midwicket
short, wide and crunched! Buffet bowling as Geoffery Boycott would say. Sat up nicely at gentle pace and Williamson gave it a proper whack
hops back and across as he tucks this to square leg. Slightly uppish but lands short.

appeal as Williamson is beaten on the drive. Gulbadin was dead sure there was a nick and went up for a review even without consulting with the wicketkeeper. Must say it was well worth a risk taking at this stage, but replays confirm there was no spike on snicko as the ball passed the bat. Williamson survives, onfield decision stays. Not out.
gets well forward and defends, got outside the line
works this full delivery on middle and leg to mid-on
balanced nicely as he works this into the gap at midwicket
just eludes midwicket as he slices this pull, had to fetch it from outside off. This just didn't come on
gets on top of the bounce and slaps this pull to the square leg boundary, brings up the fifty for New Zealand
gets right back into the crease as he defends this short of length delivery
big appeal, but the umpire reckons this may have been slipping down. Afghanistan cannot review. Was quite high, as replays confirm. So all good there. Aleem Dar was dead certain
punched to mid-on
short of a length on sixth stump, Williamson cuts but picks out short third man/gully on the ring.
short of a length on fourth stump, guided back down the pitch to Gulbadin's right.
good length ball on sixth stump, left alone.
fullish length on fifth stump, draws Williamson into a tentative prod, beats the edge.
fullish length ball on fifth stump again, this time Williamson leaves alone.
fullish length on fourth stump, driven slightly uppishly to short cover where Shahidi lunges forward to stop it.
flighted on fourth stump, no turn at 51 mph, defended to midwicket.
flighted lollipop straying down leg, well saved from being five by Alikhil.
full on the stumps, driven to long-on.
fullish length on middle, clipped through square leg.
good length on fourth stump, Taylor goes back to punch to long-on.
good length ball, smidgen of turn in as Williamson goes back to punch to cover.
quicker ball at 54 mph, almost like a carom ball spinning away from Williamson, punched to the off side.
fullish length on off, defended to mid-on.
good length on fifth stump, slapped to point.
bread and butter for Taylor outside off. Too short and too much width, crunches a cut behind point, beats third man on the rope with ease.
fullish length on fifth stump, driven firmly but straight to extra cover.
full outside off, attempted slower ball at 61 mph, drives through point, misfield allows a run.
fullish length at 75 mph and wide on a sixth stump line, square drive picks out Najibullah at backward point.
flighted very full on middle, driven to long-on.
good length on off stump, guided with an open face to short third man.
flighted on off at 51 mph/83 kph, defended to midwicket.
flighted on fourth stump, drags a drive back to Nabi who flicks onto the non-striker's stumps but Taylor is well in.
flighted on fourth stump and spinning in at 54 mph, cut off the back foot in front of point.

runout chance but really needed a direct hit from square leg. Good length ball nudged in front of the square leg umpire, Hashmatullah Shahidi swoops around from midwicket moving right but fires a very poor throw that forces Alikhil to leap in the air just to corral it. Williamson sneaks his bat across by six inches. He was gone with a better throw, even a sharper relay would've done it without a direct hit.
good length ball defended to point.
short and wide, cut to the point sweeper.
fullish length on fifth stump at 134 kph/83 mph, left alone.
short outside off, drags a pull wide of deep midwicket Rahmat running across to save two runs.
full outside off, left alone.
full outside off on sixth stump, left alone.
good length ball flighted on middle, Taylor plays around his pads awkwardly and edges through vacant slip, goes past third man to the rope.
Taylor comes down the track to a good length ball, checks a defensive block after beaten in flight.
flighted on middle, defended.
flighted full on off, defended on the front foot.
quicker ball on middle on a good length, defended again by Taylor aborting his charge.

flighted on middle at 88 kph/55 mph, defended to midwicket. Not a bad over by Rahmat. Every ball on the money, might have had a wicket first ball if his captain showed a bit of aggression in the context of Afghanistan being desperate for wickets.
fullish length on fourth stump, Williamson defends to short third man.
bouncer on off stump, Williamson ducks under, Aleem Dar at square leg says it was too high, wide called.
another bouncer, this time gives Williamson a little more trouble ducking under, Dar says the height was fine.
good length ball on off stump, goes back to prod this into midwicket.
yorker at 144 kph/89 mph, just misses off stump as Taylor is late stabbing over the top.

good length ball angled into the leg stump line, misses a flick but Williamson alertly calls for a run as the ball dribbles to forward short leg region and Williamson beats Hassan in a foot race to the striker's end.
another attempted yorker, this time on the stumps, dug out to mid-on, the throw by sub fielder Shinwari nearly takes out umpire Michael Gough, lucky not to be overthrows too.
flighted on off stump, Williamson nudges in front of point and after some hesitation with Taylor they complete a run in the end.
flighted on middle at 85 kph/53 mph, driven to extra cover.
flighted full on fourth stump, driven square to backward point.

clumsy from Hassan at cover sweeper. More air on this one from Rahmat and some width too, firm drive by Taylor through the covers and Hamid on the boundary gives it the old Matador red cape ole pulling his hands back to let it go underneath him turning one into a boundary.
good length ball on off, a bit of turn away and nudged behind point.
good length ball on fourth stump, chopped into the ground short of Noor Ali at slip.
short and very wide outside off, slapped off the toe of the bat to cover sweeper. Would've been a wide if he left it.
short outside off, Williamson with a slight shimmy forward and smokes this wide of mid-on. Sat up at Gulbadin's gentle medium pace.
bouncer outside off, left alone on height, bonus run signaled by umpire Dar at square leg.
short on off, guided with soft hands into the ground to gully.
short on off, slower ball at 96 kph/59 mph cut to Najibullah at backward point.
short outside off, punched off the back foot to cover sweeper.
good length ball outside off, bottom edge chopped into the feet of Alikhil.
flighted full on off, pushed to extra cover.
full on middle, pushed gently to extra cover.
good length ball drifting from middle to leg, goes back to clip through midwicket.
flighted on a good length on fourth stump, straightens to beat Taylor's back foot prod.
full and defended.
flighted on fourth stump, pokes at it and edges it but with soft enough hands that it doesn't come close to carrying to Noor Ali at slip.
Short and wide outside off, he uses the depth of the crease to crack that behind point, races to the third man boundary. What's worse, it's a no-ball.
biffs this full toss across the line to deep midwicket
slashed away down to square third man
bunts this slower ball gently to short third man
mistimes this pull to mid-on. Skidded on quicker than he anticipated
looks to hop back and nudge it square,  but is beaten for pace and hit on the thigh pad
chops this cut to point, didn't have the pace to work with
drifts in a full ball on the stumps, he lunges forward and defends
eased with the spin to long-off
flatter one that turns away from off-stump, defended back
steps out and eases this to long-off as they jog the single
wrists this down to long-on, sensible. Raises New Zealand's 100
works this length ball down to long-off, milking runs without a hassle
cut hard but down to square third man
dabs this gently to short third man
whips this length ball from middle to deep midwicket
forces this cut shot but can't pick the gap, straight to point

nicked but just eludes the leaping wicketkeeper! Extra bounce as Gulbadin digs this in, Taylor looks to get on top of the bounce and cut but gets it high on the bat and beats the keeper off a thick edge
looks for an ugly heave across the line, misses  completely.
drifts in a full delivery, defended back
eased with the spin to extra cover
gets well forward and smothers this full delivery
skids one into middle, punched to long-on
works this against the turn to wide long-on

drops short, Williamson pulls this long hop to the backward square leg boundary. Waited and waited to pick his spot and when the ball arrived, rolled his wrists nicely over it to ensure he kept it along the ground
mowed over deep midwicket! Even before the ball had been delivered, Taylor had decided he was going for the big hit. Picked the bones out of it
quicker one, there's sharp turn on it, cramps Taylor as he looks to late cut, gets an inside edge to short fine leg.
turns this low full toss back to the bowler
full toss on the pads, flicked to deep square
works this full toss down to wide long-on

rocks back and cuts into the gap at deep point, they come back for the second comfortably. This is a half-century for Williamson, he's been prepared for the hard grind and has reaped the rewards as the innings has progressed. Far from fluent but a fighting knock nonetheless.
gets on top of the bounce and nudges this behind square
whips this into the gap at midwicket for an easy single
top-edges this pull, Hazratullah Zazai did all the hard work in getting to the ball but let it through. Very casual

that's the end of that! Taylor has effectively missed a full toss. This one was dipping from wide of the crease, he looked to work this across the line but missed it completely. The ball hit the base of off-stump.
nips away off the seam from outside off, left alone
full toss angling in and he simply punches this back past the bowler. Sublime timing
full toss outside off, punched into the gap at sweeper cover
whips this length ball from outside off to wide long-on
nice and full outside off, he gets well forward and defends
works this square, into the vacant square leg region
whips this into the gap, down towards deep midwicket. They stroll for the second
width outside off, steered down to square third man
full and angling in from wide of the crease, pushed to mid-on
slants this length ball into middle and leg, bunted into the midwicket region
gets on top of the bounce as he taps it
huge appeal for lbw, hit on the back pad, so the ball didn't have much distance to travel. Aftab was certain, the keeper was unmoved. Inside edge
squeezes the drive to deep cover
banged in short, Williamson initially looks to duck, then realises he can upper cut, but by the time he decides to, the steep bounce carries it through to the keeper
angling into the pads, worked to deep midwicket
dragged down, pulled to deep square
works this gently to deep midwicket
width outside off and he slaps this short ball into the gap at deep extra cover. This was a slower ball, he held his shape and blasted this into the gap. Top shot
and again! The previous delivery was off the back foot, this one off the front foot. Too full, he got to the pitch and drilled this into the deep cover boundary
steered down to square third man
overpitched on middle, whipped through midwicket and it skeets away.
full on the legs, nudged behind square leg.
overpitched and angled down into the legs, misses a flick but it goes off the pads to deep fine leg.
short of a length on off, goes back to defend.
short of a length on fifth stump, guided to third man.
fullish length angled in from around the stumps on a fifth stump line drawn into a defensive poke, beaten outside off.
full and straying down leg, clipped to long leg.
short outside off, pulled along the ground to deep midwicket.
fullish length on middle and off, leading edge by Williamson trying to work it through midwicket. The ball goes to backward point where it's misfielded to allow the run.
full and angled down leg side off the pads, gets some bat on it to flick to long leg.
short of a length on fourth stump, runs it off the open face to third man.
short on off, pulled along the ground to deep square leg.
waist high full toss angled into the body from around the stumps, worked to long leg, lucky not to be called a no ball.
good length on the legs, clipped off the pads along the ground wide of Alikhil behind the stumps.
short and wide on sixth stump, guided to Zazai at third man.
short on off stump, tapped down to short third man. Scores level.
bouncer from Hamid, Latham ducks, barely legal on height. This match will go at least one more ball.
fullish length on off, Latham beaten driving. And it'll go into at least one more over now as well...
short on the legs, Williamson pulls to long leg to end the match. NZ win with 17.5 overs to spare.
